TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GroupAddress extends MimeKit.InternetAddress implements class System.IEquatable`1<class MimeKit.GroupAddress>

Docs.summary: An address group, as specified by rfc0822.
Docs.remarks: Group addresses are rarely used anymore. Typically, if you see a group address, it will be of the form: "undisclosed-recipients: ;".

MemberSignature.Value: public MimeKit.InternetAddressList Members { get; }
.property instance class MimeKit.InternetAddressList Members

Docs.summary: Gets the members of the group.
Docs.remarks: Represents the member addresses of the group. Typically the member addresses will be of the variety, but it is possible for groups to contain other groups.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ToString (bool encode);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString(bool encode) cil managed

Docs.param: If set to true, the will be encoded.
Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of the , optionally encoding it for transport.
Docs.remarks: Returns a string containing the formatted group of addresses. If the parameter is true, then the name of the group and all member addresses will be encoded according to the rules defined in rfc2047, otherwise the names will not be encoded at all and will therefor only be suitable for display purposes.

Docs.returns: true, if the address was successfully parsed, false otherwise.
Docs.remarks: Parses a single . If the the address is not a group address or there is more than a single group address, then parsing will fail.
